review: Edit: Thanks to the developers for their quick response to the earlier review (and email reply to my feedback). This is the only app that syncs flawlessly with multiple services like Microsoft To Do, Google etc. It is the best app for task-based pomodoro sessions and those productivity boosters! I wish they worked on making it more intuitive in design and animations (e.g., see the scheme of Engross app). Overall, a great app that does what it says on the label.
ras4vb:
Thanks a lot for your review, Shri!
We'd love to add My Day support, unfortunately, 1) Microsoft doesn't share any information about "My Day" selection via API so we can't sync it. 2) You can see and export your log data in your profile log page https://my.pomodoneapp.com/account/log/v2/ + connect Google Calendar, Zapier or even webhooks!

review: It was working fine in beginning, but after a while it no longer records my work time. Even though I use pomodoros, I can't find it's record in logs. So when I uninstall and reinstall the app, it works again for a few days, then again same problem occurs. I have provided all the permission for the app. But I don't know why this keeps on happening. Other than that, this app is the best.
ras4vb:
Thank you for your kind feedback.
Can I suggest re-login to the account in the app if it happened? And can you please contact us, we'd love to invite you to our new version beta testing group!

review: I really love the concept behind the app....it's really good to see all my tasks and timer integrated into this app... But the main issue with this app is that it's not rich in UI it's too dull and plain looking... no animations no drop down bar etc... It's all there in a junk Please fix this in upcoming update (s) EDIT- Thanks for the quick reply...i will surely be looking for the next update
ras4vb: Thank you for your kind feedback. We are aware of this problem and are currently working on solving it.  Please update your app to the latest version when you see an option.

review: Good integration with ToDooist, and I really like the option to minimize the clock and have it be always-on-top on a PC. Additionally, I like the level of compatibility it offers across browser plug-ins, operating systems, via web page, and across different device types. My suggested improvements, if anything, would be to add app blocking, white noise, and an additional mode in which the timer can simply be launched without having to create or access a specific task to assign it to,
ras4vb:
Thank you for your feedback. We are working on such a feature.
Did you try our browser extension already? It can block websites + embed timers into Todoist web app + offers an ambient sound pack + allows to start timer from any web page (and rename the title) + add time to the log directly.

review: After trying a few pomodoro apps, I feel like I've found the best for me. The PomoDone app model is to integrate into your preferred ToDo app rather than try to replicate the same functionality. This strikes me as exactly right - no pomodoro app can approach the ease and functionality of a good todo app, and PomoDone integrates with almost all of them. It does so flawlessly, is cross-platform and syncs in real time. (The pomodoro that shows up on my webapp is ticking away at exactly the same spot on my phone. Fantastic.) A lot of the reviews note the crappy UI and - in this - I kinda' agree. It is not beautiful. However, when you put this in context - Windows app, web app and integrations that are all slick and feature rich - PomoDone has "pomodone" a pretty fantastic job.
ras4vb:
Thank you very much for your 5-star review!
We're working on the next version with a new UI at the moment!

review: The main feature (Pomodoro timer) doesn't do long breaks on Android. I expected a long break after four working intervals (which seems to be supported in the web version), but it gave me only 5 minutes. Besides that, the app is slow, and doesn't preserve state between closing and reopening (the clock shows some strange numbers and hangs, and some strange session is recorded).

This App is so good for integrations, but they just need to put the timer up front in the UI. I just want to hit the button and go and decide what I did later, but currently I need to find the task  up front, which is a serious pain and a severe mark on an app that would otherwise be perfect for what it does.

This is a FANTASTIC app! If you are using ToDoist than Pomodone seems like it was built purely to enable your productivity goals in ToDoist! Together, these apps are unbeatable! If you need to plan, schedule or prioritise your time, then you must by all means try using Pomodone along with ToDoist for an unbeatable, smooth and integrated solution! Though I do not use Pomodone by itself, it would indeed be a very good and effective time tracking solution, though there are others paid apps that are likewise good. THE BEST features I find to be the genius way that the app ties in to ToDoist, Trello and other such apps, (syncing all of your lists, schedules and priorities), and also the way that you must choose the amount of time, (5m, 10m, 15m, 25m, etc) rather than having a continual standard of timer minutes running. REALLY WELL DONE!!!
ras4vb: Thank you so much for your review! You were able to catch the precise idea why we did it this way! Awesome!

review: The underlying idea is absolutely fantastic - integrate a feature complete pomdoro timer with the task management tool of your choice. The WebApp does implement this feature set pretty well, even though there are some major pain points - e.g. adding Log entries manually is very cumbersome and the integration with some services is buggy. Sadly enough the Android App is quite terrible (compared to the WebApp), and I ended up using the WebApp on the phone despite it not integrating into the underlying OS very well: 1. The Android App does not implement sleep / power saving properly and requires exceptions from the Android Battery Management System. But if the exception is granted the battery is drained dramatically by the app, so much that the phone runs very hot in my pocket 2. The Project/Task view is unusable - everytime a project is folded and unfolded again all tasks in the project are added to the list of tasks again. This means the list keeps growing and growing and this is persisted beyoned a app restart. The only fix is to clear the app cache and let it re-download the tasks from the connected task management tools (Asana in this case) 3. No configuration of Timer Alarm (e.g. use vibration only) 4. Cannot turn off screen to run in background because the alarms work inconsitently. Even if the app is listed as a priority app in the Do-not-Disturb exception list, the timer alarms don't get through

*good* app but overall polish is missing not just in this app but all other apps associated with pomodone, this is a real shame as the integrations work really well but the user experience is so bad that trying to use the app is so painful at times that it's close to pointless. I do hope the devs look at improving the ui and general user experience. It does not fill you with confidence using this app and connecting third party services when it appears that the attention to detail is missing..

Very good idea and nice execution. Integrations are working very well. However, 1) The UI doesnt look very nice. 2) In the Windows 10 app, adding a task with just the date but no time dowsn't seem to be possible. Is that the case? EDIT - Thanks for the quick reply. Please try and improve the UI to make it more easy to use.
ras4vb:
Hi Nar, thank you for your feedback. 
The due date's time for Desktop/Web app's defined as the end of the day, meaning the whole day is within the due date. 
You can adjust it. Not sure how is it relevant to Google Play though ;)
EDIT - Thanks for the review and adjustment! We work on UI!

review: Utter Garbage. Stops is between, doesn't have a good interface. A very passive app which stops on it's own and doesn't work well. I don't usually write reviews but this app just was too much and I'm having this issues almost every day. Only Good thing is ADs üòê I had the lite version and I regret having it.
ras4vb: Thanks for your feedback. The app does not stop in between by itself but could be killed by Android OS if you didn't configure the battery-saving allowance (or device-specific layer settings e.g. screen sleeping ones). As far as the Lite plan, can you please contact us with your account details and we'll see what we can do about it? Thanks

review: The phone app doesn't sync with the web and windows desktop ones. The timer button of the chrome extension has stopped working with the Todoist web app. But, the team is working hard and communicating professionally. Willing to give the guys more time to fix the issues.

The timer always stopped and I lost track of my time again and again. It was supposed to be a productive app but not to me. I have turned off the battery optimisation for this app and it worked for awhile like for 5 times before it crashed again. I'm dissapointed.

As others have said the UI is lacking as well as the integrations. Missing attention to detail and in general needs more polish. It "works" but definitely not the best experience. Is buggy and still needs some major improvements.Hope they can fix these issues and continue to improve further.
ras4vb: Hi, we are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback.

review: The app has great potential and integrating services like Google calendar and tasks is a great plus. However it lacks some work in the interface and rethinking a little the workflow. Also adding some visuals to the statistics will be very helpful.
ras4vb: Thank you Maikol, we're working on the interface. As far as the visual/stats, can you take a look at app's Sidebar menu > Current Stats?

review: Trello integration is a feature. But the essential qualities of a pomodoro timer isn't there. Merely a vibrate sound which I never hear when engrossed in work. Enabling the sound makes horrible constant ticking sounds instead. Uninstalling for now.
ras4vb:
Thanks for your feedback, Hikari. 
You can turn off the constant ticking sound (there are 2 settings for the timer, one is looped and one just to notify you about the timer start). The same for a break. It's customizable. 
Vibration and notification work if your device allows it + if the app is not visible at the moment (e.g. in the background).

review: This app help me focus on my work. Very useful to work in 5, 15, 25 minutes, you can split your big work to small task to complete, it is easier. The app also integrate with your already app like Wunderlist, Trello ... Many many extensions are free. Very happy with free license and I will consider subscription license in future. Thanks author!!
ras4vb: Thanks for your review! Please recommend our app to your friends, and don‚Äôt hesitate to shoot us a note at Info@pomodoneapp.com if you have any questions.

review: Doesn't sync the tasks from my Microsoft Todo list even though it's linked. Rosponse: There's an App called Microsoft Todo. I think that's one only todo app the have on playstore. I've linked the app but when i add the task in pomodone using the Add icon it gives me a blank screen. Nor does it sync any tasks from my List from the Todo app.
ras4vb:
Hi Joe, Thanks for your feedback. Can I ask which Microsoft ToDo's list are you talking about? Looking forward to hearing from you soon. Best, Alex
Update: Can you please contact us via our website's feedback form or live chat system? We need to know your account.

review: Good platform integration with a basic Pomodoro function. Still needs some elaboration in presentation and gamification...e.g incentives, garden grows, levels or points etc. Can be optional but for personal use it's still too plain to get enthusiasm even if functioning well.
ras4vb:
Hi, 
We've forwarded your feedback to our developers. Thank you for taking out the time to send us your suggestions!

review: Tremendously bad app. Sluggish as hell. Wasted a good amount of time of thinking it would be a good app to work with. Tried only because it had multi device syncing capability. But nope! Its slow as snail. Uninstalling with big frustration.
ras4vb:
Thanks for the explanation. 
Big surprise it works as expected on our devices and on thousands of users' ones. I am not sure how can we fix it for your device though. Thanks for the review.

review: Desktop good. App has been terrible. But today its working. It has alway been unstable. Randomly freezing and just useless. But its working now. I hope as a result of an upgrade. If it does then 5* await.

review: Auto rotation feature in the mobile app is annoying. Also the app is missing some features to add music before starting the task and adding music before the break time is not possible. If the app has the feature to add different music for the task and the break time before starting the task it will act as a reminder to complete the task.

Hello, I have a question. Based on your earlier answers you said a sound on timer start is possible. However, I only have the option for a looped sound or No Sound. How can I have a sound played once on timer start? Regarding your response, you've already helped someone through this format regarding what I just mentioned. So I would appreciate if you did me the same courtesy and provide a public response to this issue.
ras4vb: Hello! Thank you for your positive feedback! We are pleased that you are satisfied with the application! Can you please contact us via our in-app form or using our website to sort it out?

review: The app is kind of useless when you want to track time for activity on the same device. Devs: have a proper foreground service that will also display the timer as a notification. How come it wasn't done like that in the first place? What's the point of a timer that can be killed by the OS at any time? Update: did you try implementing foreground service as any other app of this kind, instead of asking users to tweak the battery settings (which obviously doesn't work btw)?
ras4vb:
Thanks, Szymon, 
Unfortunately, OS can kill anything at any time, especially if its configured the way. Did you try to adjust the Battery Settings?
UPD. Yes we did. Can you please contact us directly? Thanks!

review: *This application has changed my life* I really appreciate this app. It helps me to sync and organise my work for maximum productivity. This application has literally changed my life. I downloaded this app in my Windows and it has truly made me a better and more productive version of myself. Highly recommend this.

review: Brilliant to have the Trello integration but the UI is really disappointing. If you could replicate the UI of 'engross' with a proper amoled black theme etc you'd be on to a real winner!!

review: Didn't integrate with my to-do service (Chaos Control) and I didn't like the way it switches between tasks. I'll keep looking...

Hey, can u please add Taskade in the synced lost of platforms. Taskade is on the rise for go-to task platform. I love using both taskade and pomodone. Having both of them together would even be better and seamless. Thank you.
Very hard to navigate, the settings don't get saved, no in-app guidance. The desktop version is very good though

review: Awesome app! This is my go to pomodoro timer. I have it integrated with Trello and Todoist and it works like a charm. If offers a lot of flexibility and tons of stats. Great work!
ras4vb: Thank you very much for your 5-star review!!!

review: The whole service is interesting, the gui is not comparable to the good competitors, needs improvements on this side, especially the android app. I don't understand the presentation as these integrations are presented as non premium features :  Trello ‚Ä¢ Todoist ‚Ä¢ Wunderlist ‚Ä¢ Evernote ‚Ä¢ Âç∞Ë±°Á¨îËÆ∞ (YinXiang) ‚Ä¢ Google Calendar & iCal ‚Ä¢ Microsoft ToDo ‚Ä¢ Zapier ‚Ä¢ Toodledo ‚Ä¢ OmniFocus ‚Ä¢ Google Tasks  Which is wrong, except trello and todoist, you won't be able to integrate the others. This is wrong marketing here. EDIT: Thank you for the answer, noted and verified, one more star. Good news for the gui which really needs it
ras4vb:
Hi Alexandre, thanks for your feedback. 
Our free plan offers you to add up to 2  integrations from the list, but you can add any 2 from the list, not only Trello and Todoist. 
We're working on UI at the moment.

review: Update :- Now the app seems to work, syncs perfectly with the web, no need to uninstall and reinstall after 4-5 days, for it to sync (work properly), but when clicking on current stats it shows stale data and doesn't update at all just loads indefinitely.
ras4vb:
Can you please check different layers of battery saving that can kill the app in the background? It can be quite specific for your model and can have a special manager app for battery saving, sleep mode, screen dimming etc.

Thank you for re-considering!

review: Superb web service and great well thought through app! Just wish that the timer would work in background even with battery optimisation on. I keep losing timers :(

review: It's a great app. You have to give some time to establish integrations but after this it's a game changer. The app even log time automatically to Jira! Bravo

review: I would like to see a proper implementation of timer sync that includes a persistant notification in Android to display the active timer. I want to view my active timer outside of the PomoDone App, and on my Wear OS watch. Is this on the roadmap?
ras4vb:
Hi Ennis, 
Can I ask, did you turn on Timer Sync in Profile Settings: 
https://my.pomodoneapp.com/profile/settings/#sync
If it's on, you'll be able to see the current timer on all of your PomoDone App instances (including Chrome ext), will be able to stop it and even receive the notifications, if your Android apps notification is turned on.

review: Everything is good and the app works perfectly but it's unnecessarily bloated. Why does a Pomodoro Timer require 50 mb? I loved the app but it's bloated characteristic made me switch to Engross.
